news_header: Yvonne Aki-Sawyerr, mayor of Freetown, Sierra Leone, has transformed the city through sustainable initiatives and was awarded the 2024 German Africa Prize for her efforts.
news_text: Yvonne Aki-Sawyerr, who grew up in Freetown, Sierra Leone, was inspired to run for mayor to restore her city after witnessing its decline. Since taking office six years ago, she has significantly improved housing, water supply, and waste management, earning international recognition, including the 2024 German Africa Prize. Aki-Sawyerr's initiatives include the 'Transform Freetown' plan, aimed at addressing waste issues and planting trees, with a goal of one million trees planted. She has also implemented innovative projects like wastewater treatment and solar-powered water kiosks. Despite challenges, Aki-Sawyerr remains committed to sustainable urban development and community involvement, emphasizing that her work is for the benefit of Freetown's residents.
